column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form, continuous or simple.
column3: I {{c1::saw}} (see) Sue in town yesterday, but she {{c1::didn't see|did not see}} (not / see) me. She {{c1::was looking}} (look) the other way.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form, continuous or simple.
column3:
I {{c1::met}} (meet) Tom and Jane at the airport a few weeks ago.
They {{c1::were going}} (go) to Paris, and I {{c1::was going}} (go) to Rome.
We {{c1::went}} (go) to a cafe and {{c1::had}} (have) a chat while we were waiting for our flights.

column2: Complete the sentences. Put the verb in the correct form, continuous or simple.
column3:
I {{c1::was cycling}} (cycle) home yesterday when a man {{c1::stepped}} (step) out into the road in front of me.
I {{c1::was going}} (go) quite fast, but fortunately I {{c1::managed}} (manage) to stop in time and I {{c1::didn't hit|did not hit}} (not / hit) him.
